item.title: And God Said, 'Care, Dammit'
item.description: I was working on a short story about an exorcist (which I've since abandoned) so I decided to read The Exorcist. I've seen the movie but can't say I'm a fan. The book is excellent. One passage stood out. It's said by Merrin, the senior exorcist, to Damien, the amateur who's been having a crisis of faith: Long ago I despaired of ever loving my neighbor. Certain people repelled me. How could I love them?
